meanings.definition: One who takes the place of another, especially by force or treachery.
meanings.sent1: The supplanter claimed the throne after overthrowing the king.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was seen as a supplanter by the long-time staff.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky supplanter switched the labels on the jars as a prank.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn can become a powerful supplanter of the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent5: The cunning supplanter outwitted his rivals to become the leader of the pack.

meanings.definition: To take the place of another, especially by force or treachery.
meanings.sent1: The rebel group aimed to supplant the corrupt government with a new system.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious politician plotted to supplant his opponent in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to supplant the cat as the household pet.
meanings.sent4: The rising star in the company worked hard to supplant the current manager.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete trained rigorously to supplant the reigning champion in the competition.
